title: How to Make a Photo Memory Quilt

steps.headline: Choose the size of quilt you want to make.
steps.description:
Standard bed sizes are as follows:
Mattress Sizes
Twin--39 x 75 inches (or 99 x 190 cm)
X-Long Twin--39 x 80 inches (99 x 203 cm)
Full--54 x 75 inches (137 x 190 cm)
Queen--60 x 80 inches (or 153 x 203 cm)
King--76 x 80 inches (or 198 x 203 cm)
California King--72 x 84 inches (or 182 x 213 cm)

steps.headline: Divide the size of blanket by the size of quilt blocks you wish to sew, and add width for seam allowances, borders, and any other design considerations.
Obtain enough material for your chosen size of quilt.
steps.description: Choose white or very light colored materials for the photo transfer blocks.

steps.headline: Launder and iron all fabric before cutting or sewing.
Transfer your photos to your light colored quilt fabric as shown in this article: Transfer Photographs to Fabric
Proceed with sewing a quilt as shown in this article: Make a Quilt

text:
Choose the size of quilt you want to make. Standard bed sizes are as follows:
Mattress Sizes
Twin--39 x 75 inches (or 99 x 190 cm)
X-Long Twin--39 x 80 inches (99 x 203 cm)
Full--54 x 75 inches (137 x 190 cm)
Queen--60 x 80 inches (or 153 x 203 cm)
King--76 x 80 inches (or 198 x 203 cm)
California King--72 x 84 inches (or 182 x 213 cm) Divide the size of blanket by the size of quilt blocks you wish to sew, and add width for seam allowances, borders, and any other design considerations.  Obtain enough material for your chosen size of quilt. Choose white or very light colored materials for the photo transfer blocks. Launder and iron all fabric before cutting or sewing.  Transfer your photos to your light colored quilt fabric as shown in this article: Transfer Photographs to Fabric  Proceed with sewing a quilt as shown in this article: Make a Quilt
